Golf Bags Made in China

Years ago, China was the knockoff capital with the world. Knockoff products from cheap women bags to books to CDs prevailed and were designed for pennies on the dollar. Military personnel stationed in Taiwan and Southeast Asia used to laugh about the prices and how you could go broke saving revenue.

Today, things have changed a small amount. China suppliers still offer several cheap knockoff products, but as trade with Chinese suppliers increases and American companies will use Chinese manufacturing plants and skilled Chinese labor producing their products, including golf totes, the consumer struggles to find out who is the legitimate manufacturer and that's producing knockoff products.

Recently, Callaway Golf moved a manufacturing facility in New York State to help China. The lost jobs were skilled labor. Callaway Golf had an intriguing rationale for their move. They stated that the market for their products was becoming world wide and they wanted to place several their manufacturing plants closer to their international buyers. Callaway was never concerned about the ability in the Chinese labor force to keep up their high manufacturing standards.

Callaway isn't alone. All the big golf-club and golf bag manufacturers, among them Taylormade, Ping, Srixon, Titleist, Benetti and many more are already or soon can be manufacturing <b>Callaway FT-i Squareway Wood</b> golf bags in The far east.

However, the knockoff the game bag problem still prevails. Online review after review complains concerning poor quality of what the buyer perceived was a name manufacturer's cheap discount golf bag.
